articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Message of Greeting to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Message of Greeting to Syrian President
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
					 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, government and people of friendly Syria on that occasion.
					
					 The corrective movement in Syria was a historic event which brought about a radical turn in the struggle of the people of Syria for defending the national sovereignty and dignity and achieving peace and stability in the region under the leadership of President Hafez Al-Assad, it noted.
					
					 It sincerely wished the Syrian people bigger successes in their just struggle for protecting the sovereignty and security of the country from the hostile forces' challenges, convinced of the justice of their cause under the President's correct leadership.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Former Unconverted Long-Term Prisoner
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Former Unconverted Long-Term Prisoner
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Sunday sent a birthday spread to Ri Kyong Chan, former unconverted long-term prisoner who is indomitable pro-reunification patriotic fighter, on the occasion of his 80th birthday. 
					 He was arrested by enemies while waging a sacred struggle for the country's reunification. He remained true to his revolutionary principle by waging heroic struggle for several decades.
					
					 After his coming back to the care of the Republic leader Kim Jong Il made sure that he was awarded high state commendations including a watch bearing the august name of President Kim Il Sung, the title of DPRK Hero and National Reunification Prize.
					
					 Kim Jong Un invited Ri to participate in the celebrations of the centenary of the birth of the President, the events for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. He showed warm loving care for Ri so that he might glorify his life as pro-reunification patriotic fighter, keeping himself in good health despite his advanced age.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Families Who Moved to New Flats
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Families Who Moved to New Flats
Pyongyang, November 15, 2015 22:13 KST (KCNA) â€” Senior officials of the party and state on Sunday visited families of teachers and scientists who moved to new flats in apartment houses in the Mirae Scientists Street.
					 They included Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and others and vice-premiers of the Cabinet.
					
					 They congratulated the educators and teachers enjoying boundless happiness at de luxe new flats.
					
					 After giving them household articles as souvenirs, the visitors heard about their impressions and told them touching stories about Marshal Kim Jong Un's devoted efforts to bring about this happy event.
					
					 They told the educators and scientists to invariably play the roles of standard-bearers and members of the shock brigade in the drive to turn the country into a scientific and technological power, power of talents, always remembering the Marshal's warm loving care.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Foreign Minister's Reckless Remarks on "North's Nuclear Issue"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Foreign Minister's Reckless Remarks on "North's Nuclear Issue"
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- South Korean Foreign Minister Yun Pyong Se at a recent international meeting held in Luxembourg cried out for  "sending a consistent message to the north disallowing its nuclear program," asserting that "it is bolstering up its nuclear and missile capabilities even at this moment." Touring an Asian country a few days later, he talked rubbish that "south Korea hopes the country would exercise positive influence on the solution of the north's nuclear issue" and "it wishes to see the north draw a lesson."
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 What Yun uttered was the ridiculous behavior of the guy who is ignorant of the essence and cause of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and reckless remarks creating only complexities and obstacles in the way of dialogue and the improvement of relations between the north and the south. 
					
					 Yun's behavior blindly following his American master in the U.S. anti-DPRK nuclear racket, bereft of any elementary knowledge about the nuclear issue reminds one of a blind pony.
					
					 Yun would be well advised to clearly know the reason why the DPRK had access to nuclear weapons, its historic course and what should be done before denuclearizing the peninsula. 
					
					 There is order in solving any problem. If the nuclear issue is to find a fundamental solution on the peninsula, the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers should put an end to their policy of nuclear blackmail and moves for igniting a war of aggression against the north as they are disturbing peace on the peninsula. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should understand that their desperate political and military provocations against the compatriots in the north in collusion with outside forces over the "nuclear issue of the north" are nothing but foolish acts of making the issue of improving the inter-Korean relations more complicated and laying insurmountable hurdles in its way.
					
					 They should halt their diplomacy for seeking cooperation in the anti-DPRK nuclear racket as it hamstrings the efforts for the denuclearization of the peninsula and pushes the inter-Korean relations to a catastrophe.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Make Fundamental Switchover in Its Confrontation Policy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Make Fundamental Switchover in Its Confrontation Policy
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- If the south Korean authorities persistently keep to the road of confrontation with the compatriots in the north while seeking cooperation with outside forces in the anti-DPRK campaign, they may scupper the hard-won atmosphere of improving the relations between the north and south in a moment.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday warns this in an article.
					
					 It is absolutely impossible to improve the inter-Korean relations as long as they pursue the policy of antagonizing the compatriots with whom they should join hands for the nation's unity and reunification, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The confrontation policy of the south Korean authorities will only foster distrust and contradiction between the north and the south.
					
					 They should drop their daggers hidden behind their belts before talking about "dialogue" and make a bold decision to make a  fundamental switchover in their anti-DPRK confrontation policy.
					
					 It is an immediate urgent matter for the Korean nation to mend the relations between the north and the south.
					
					 Clear is the DPRK's stand on this issue. 
					
					 The DPRK will join hands with whoever stands for improving the inter-Korean relations in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself, sincerely desiring reunification.
					
					 However, it will never allow but decisively counter those working hard to hurt the nation's destiny and the fate of the inter-Korean relations in collusion with outside forces, pursuing the anti-DPRK confrontation policy contrary to the nation's will and wishes. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to roll back their anachronistic confrontation policy and sincerely opt for repairing the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Make Reparation for Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Make Reparation for Its Past Crimes
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- This year the world community has urged Japan to seriously reflect on its history woven with massacres, destruction and plunder and make adequate apology and reparation for them as it brought unspeakable misfortune and suffering to the Korean and other Asians in the last century.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 However, Japan is meanly behaving to cover up its blood-stained history, far from apologizing for it.
					
					 Japan's past crimes can never be forgotten by the people simply because much water has flown under the bridge. The Japanese reactionaries are sadly mistaken if they calculate that their crime-woven past can be erased from the people's memories.
					
					 The Korean people will certainly force Japan to pay a thousand-fold price for the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists despite the passage of such a long time.
					
					 Any attempt of Japan to hide its past crimes leads to its isolation and self-destruction.
					
					 The Japanese authorities should admit their state responsibility for all crimes against humanity and make reparation to all Koreans in a manner understandable to them, keenly aware that with no gimmick can they embellish or write off their past crimes.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Hungary
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Hungary
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed in Budapest under the sponsorship of the Hungarian Workers' Party on November 10.
					 Gyula Thurmer, chairman of the Hungarian Workers' Party, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to Kim Jong Il's exploits and to organize political and cultural events on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Spain
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Spain
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed in Madrid on November 9.
					 Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize various events praising revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il including remembrance meeting, seminar and photo exhibition from November 10 to December 20.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Germany
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed by the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany on November 9.
					 The chairman of the forum was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il including reading session and lecture from November 9 to December 17.

articles.title: DPRK's Proposal for Peace Treaty Supported by Nigeria
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal for Peace Treaty Supported by Nigeria
Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian government sent a note to the DPRK embassy in Abuja on November 6 in support of the proposal of the DPRK government for replacing the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty.
					 The note in the name of the Nigerian Foreign Ministry said that Nigeria takes a particular note of the stand of the DPRK government on replacing the Korean Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty in order to defuse the danger of the outbreak of a war on the Korean Peninsula and create lasting peaceful environment. It went on:
					
					 The Nigerian government has always supported all the proposals of the DPRK government for ensuring lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 From this viewpoint, the Nigerian government appreciates the proposal for concluding a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. made by the former on October 17, 2015 as a very important and aboveboard one.
					
					 It will positively support the proposals of the DPRK for ensuring lasting peace and security not only on the Korean Peninsula but also in Northeast Asia and achieving bigger economic progress.
